title: Emergencies & Health
objectives: Get help quickly in urgent situations
Call or direct someone to emergency services
context: Keep sentences short and clear in emergencies—keywords matter more than grammar.
119 is Korea's emergency number (ambulance/fire). 112 is police.
At pharmacies or clinics, describing symptoms simply gets you quick aid.

sentences.english: Where is the hospital emergency room?
I have a bad headache. Do you have medicine?

sentences.korean: 저는 땅콩 알레르기가 있어요. 이 약 먹어도 돼요?
sentences.english: I have a peanut allergy. Can I take this medicine?
sentences.romanization: jeoneun ttangkong allereugi-ga isseoyo. i yak meogeodo dwaeyo?

explanation: Shout 도와주세요! or 경찰 불러 주세요! (Please call the police). Mention the issue fast: 사고 났어요 (There was an accident).
Emergency numbers: 119 for ambulance/fire, 112 for police. Say 위치 (location) + 상황 (situation).
At a pharmacy, say 증상이 뭐예요? (What are the symptoms?) or name them: 두통/복통/기침(=cough). Add 며칠째예요 (for how many days).
Use -아/어도 돼요? for permission: 이 약 먹어도 돼요? (Is it okay to take this?).
If you have allergies or conditions, say it first: 저는 ___ 알레르기가 있어요 / 저는 약에 알레르기 있어요.
